TopicTitle: StarSpeaker Industries - Coming soon if it gets enough supportive posts

Articles.Content:
StarSpeaker Industries will be a ship and parts add-on for KSP, just to spice it up a little. Most of the StarSpeaker parts are modded stock parts, and some of the ships use other mods.

Here are my current additions:

1. Small hardpoint identical to the stock hardpoint, only non-crossfeed-capable, making it lighter and allowing permanent engines with separate fuel supplies.

2. Aerodynamic nosecone also identical to its stock counterpart, only it contains a small supply of fuel.

3. Crossfeed-capable and slightly heavier Mk2 cockpit.

If you guys think this project would be worthwhile, leave a supportive comment.

Yeah. I only know how to edit, copy and paste scripts. I could take the cfg edit parts and add my own model textures and meshes. What would be a good 3D modeling system to use?
if your a begginer to modeling i recomend Wings3D

Don't let a lack of community input stop you! Nutt seems to always be there in new threads giving support, but you could post all day without much comment unless you're Dani-Sang or Nova. Don't let that stop you.

As far as modelling, you might want to take a look at Blender for meshes and Gimp or Photoshop for textures. Blender's Achilles heel is its lack of documentation, but googling usually reveals everything you need to know.

Check the forums for the thread on the basics of a ksp part -- there's a quick tutorial on how to make a simple model and collider node that explains the basics you need to get moving.

Just be sure not to post anything you didn't make or don't have permission to use

Good luck!
